column1: Stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS) is a form of radiation therapy that focuses high-power energy on a small area of the body.
Despite its name, radiosurgery is a treatment, not a surgical procedure.
Gamma Knife radiosurgery is done only for tumors and other medical problems of the head.
Before treatment, you are fitted with a head frame.

Gamma Knife radiosurgery is used to treat the following types of brain tumors: - Cancer that has spread (metastasized) to the brain from another part of the body - A slow-growing tumor of the nerve that connects the ear to the brain (acoustic neuroma) - Pituitary tumors - Tumors that are not cancer (chordoma, meningioma) Gamma Knife is also used to treat other problems of the brain: - Blood vessel problems (arteriovenous malformation, arteriovenous fistula) - Some types of epilepsy - Trigeminal neuralgia (severe nerve painnerve pain of the face) - Severe tremors due to essential tremor or Parkinson disease
In rare cases, surgery with incisions (open surgery) is needed to treat the brain swelling caused by the radiation.
